## TaskOptions class

`task options` can be seen as a definition of a `task`<!-- -->. It is used to create `task` by calling [TaskManager.task()](./processor.taskmanager.task.md)<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class TaskOptions<Hooks extends BaseHooks<Hooks> = {}, HookName extends keyof Hooks = keyof Hooks> 
```

## Remarks

The reason why we use the `task`<!-- -->'s definition instead of directly using the `task` itself is that usually we want share our `task`<!-- -->'s definition not the `task` itself.

The reason why we need this class rather than a simple object is that we can organize `task options` easily by it's props and methods.

The [series](./processor.series.md) and [parallel](./processor.parallel.md) can help to compose `task options`<!-- -->.

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [action](./processor.taskoptions.action.md) |  | (this: [Task](./processor.task.md)<!-- -->&lt;Hooks, HookName&gt;) =&gt; Promisable&lt;void&gt; | Invoked when the corresponding <code>task</code> is running. |
|  [hns](./processor.taskoptions.hns.md) |  | HookName\[\] | The <code>hook name</code>s that the corresponding <code>task</code> could call with. |
|  [hooks](./processor.taskoptions.hooks.md) |  | Partial&lt;Hooks&gt; | The preset hooks of the corresponding <code>task</code>. |

|  --- | --- | --- |
